bugs
Class Parser

java.lang.Object
  bugs.Parser

public class Parser
extends java.lang.Object

Parser for numeric expressions. Used as starter code for the Bugs language parser in CIT594, Spring 2015.

Version:
February 2015
Author:
Dave Matuszek and Theresa Breiner

Field Summary
 java.util.Stack<tree.Tree<Token>> stack
          The stack used for holding Trees as they are created.

stack

public java.util.Stack<tree.Tree<Token>> stack
The stack used for holding Trees as they are created.

Constructor Detail

Parser

public Parser(java.lang.String text)
Constructs a Parser for the given string.

Parameters:
text - The string to be parsed.
Method Detail

isExpression

public boolean isExpression()
Tries to build an <expression> on the global stack. 
<expression> ::= <arithmetic expression> {  <comparator> <arithmetic expression> }
A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <expression>.

Returns:
true if an expression is parsed.

isArithmeticExpression

public boolean isArithmeticExpression()
Tries to build an <expression> on the global stack. 
<expression> ::= <term> { <add_operator> <expression> }
A SyntaxException will be thrown if the add_operator is present but not followed by a valid <expression>.

Returns:
true if an expression is recognized.

isTerm

public boolean isTerm()
Tries to build a <term> on the global stack. 
<term> ::= <factor> { <multiply_operator> <term> }
A SyntaxException will be thrown if the multiply_operator is present but not followed by a valid <term>.

Returns:
true if a term is parsed.

isFactor

public boolean isFactor()
Tries to build a <factor> on the global stack. 
<factor> ::= [ <unsigned factor> ] <name>
A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.

Returns:
true if a factor is parsed.

isUnsignedFactor

public boolean isUnsignedFactor()
Tries to build an <unsigned factor> on the global stack. 
<unsigned factor> ::= <variable> . <variable>
                    | <function call>
                    | <variable>
                    | <number>
                    | "(" <expression> ")"
A SyntaxException will be thrown if the opening parenthesis is present but not followed by a valid <expression> and a closing parenthesis.

Returns:
true if a factor is parsed.

isParameterList

public boolean isParameterList()
Tries to recognize a <parameter list>. 
<parameter list> ::= "(" [ <expression> { "," <expression> } ] ")"






Returns:
true if a parameter list is recognized.

isAddOperator

public boolean isAddOperator()
Tries to recognize an <add_operator> and put it on the global stack. 
<add_operator> ::= "+" | "-"

Returns:
true if an addop is recognized.

isMultiplyOperator

public boolean isMultiplyOperator()
Tries to recognize a <multiply_operator> and put it on the global stack. 
<multiply_operator> ::= "*" | "/"

Returns:
true if a multiply_operator is recognized.

isVariable

public boolean isVariable()
Tries to parse a <variable>; same as <isName>. 
<variable> ::= <NAME>

Returns:
true if a variable is parsed.

isAction

public boolean isAction()
Tries to recognize an <action>. 
<action> ::= <move action> | <moveto action> 
 | <turn action> | <turnto action> | <line action>

Returns:
true if an action is recognized.

isAllbugsCode

public boolean isAllbugsCode()
Tries to recognize an <allbugs code>. 
<allbugs code> ::= "Allbugs" "{" <eol> 
 { <var declaration> } { <function definition> } "}" <eol>

Returns:
true if an allbugs code is recognized.

isAssignmentStatement

public boolean isAssignmentStatement()
Tries to recognize <assignment statement> and push it to the stack. 
<assignment statement> ::= <variable> "=" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes assignment statement.

isBlock

public boolean isBlock()
Tries to recognize a <block> and push it to the stack 
<block> ::= "{" <eol> { <command> } "}" <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a block

isBugDefinition

public boolean isBugDefinition()
Tries to recognize a <bug definition> 
<bug definition> ::= "Bug" <name> "{" <eol>
 { <var declaration> } [ <initialization block> ] <command>
 { <command> } { <function definition> } "}" <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a bug definition.

isColorStatement

public boolean isColorStatement()
Tries to recognize a <color statement> and push it on the stack. 
<color statement> ::= "color" <KEYWORD> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a color statement

isCommand

public boolean isCommand()
Tries to recognize a <command> 
<commandt> ::= <action> | <statement>

Returns:
true if recognizes a command

isComparator

public boolean isComparator()
Tries to recognize a <comparator> and push whole comparator on the stack. 
<comparator> ::= "<" | "<=" 
 | "=" | "!=" | ">=" | ">"

Returns:
true if a comparator is recognized.

isDoStatement

public boolean isDoStatement()
Tries to recognize a <do statement> and push it onto stack. 
<do statement> ::= "do" <variable> [ <parameter list> ] <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a do statement

isEol

public boolean isEol()
Tries to recognize an <eol> and pops it from the stack. 
<eol> ::= <EOL> { <EOL> }

Returns:
true if an end of line is recognized.

isExitIfStatement

public boolean isExitIfStatement()
Tries to recognize an <exit if statement> and push it to the stack. 
<exit if statement> ::= "exit" "if" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if an exit if statement is recognized.

isFunctionCall

public boolean isFunctionCall()
Tries to recognize a <function call> and push it to the stack. 
<function call> ::= <NAME> <parameter list>

Returns:
true if a function call is recognized.

isFunctionDefinition

public boolean isFunctionDefinition()
Tries to recognize a <function definition> and push it to the stack. 
<function definition> ::= "define" <NAME> [ "using" <variable> 
 { "," <variable> } ] <block>

Returns:
true if a function definition is recognized.

isInitializationBlock

public boolean isInitializationBlock()
Tries to recognize an <initialization block> and push it to the stack. 
<initialization block> ::= "initially" <block>

Returns:
true if an initialization block is recognized.

isLineAction

public boolean isLineAction()
Tries to recognize a <line action> and push it to the stack. 
 <line action> ::= "line" <expression> "," 
 <expression> "," <expression> "," <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a line action

isLoopStatement

public boolean isLoopStatement()
Tries to recognize a <loop statement> and push it to the stack. 
<loop statement> ::= "loop" <block>

Returns:
true if recognizes a loop statement.

isMoveAction

public boolean isMoveAction()
Tries to recognize a <move action> and push it to the stack. 
<move action> ::= "move" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a move action.

isMoveToAction

public boolean isMoveToAction()
Tries to recognize a <moveto action> and push it to the stack. 
<moveto action> ::= "moveto" <expression> "," 
 <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a moveto action

isProgram

public boolean isProgram()
Tries to recognize a <program>. 
<program> ::= [ <allbugs code> ] <bug definition> { <bug definition> }

Returns:
true if recognizes a program

isReturnStatement

public boolean isReturnStatement()
Tries to recognize a <return statement> and push it to the stack. 
<return statement> ::= "return" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes return statement

isStatement

public boolean isStatement()
Tries to recognize a <statement>. 
<statement> ::= <assignment statement> | 
 <loop statement> | <exit if statement> | <switch statement> 
 | <return statement> | <do statement> | <color statement>

Returns:
true if recognizes statement

isSwitchStatement

public boolean isSwitchStatement()
Tries to recognize a <switch statement> and push it to the stack. 
<switch statement> ::= "switch" "{" <eol> 
 { "case" <expression> <eol> { <command> } } "}" <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes switch statement

isTurnAction

public boolean isTurnAction()
Tries to recognize a <turn action> and push it on the stack. 
<turn action> ::= "turn" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a turn action.

isTurnToAction

public boolean isTurnToAction()
Tries to recognize a <turnto action> and push it to the stack. 
<turnto action> ::= "turnto" <expression> <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a turnto action.

isVarDeclaration

public boolean isVarDeclaration()
Tries to recognize a <var declaration> and push it to the stack. 
<var declaration> ::= "var" <NAME> { "," <NAME> } <eol>

Returns:
true if recognizes a var declaration.
